availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Jackson Carr (Sumner County, Tennessee, physician)

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, merchant and physician. Tennessee native. Married Nancy Ann Marshall Carr in Campbell, Tennessee, on March 18, 1852. Father of Alonry W Carr, Adolphus Carr, and Allison Carr. Merchant in Anderson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Physician in Sumner County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Anderson County, p. 26A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Sumner County, p. 467.
_Tennessee Marriage Records, 1780-2002, Nashville, Tennessee, Cheatham County Marriages, p.112.
Find A Grave, "Richard Jackson Carr (February 26, 1826-February 12, 1899)," Memorial #20548728, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/20548728 (accessed January 16, 2020).
